sentences.sContent: We regret any inconvenience caused to our customers.
sentences.sCn: 我们对于给顾客造成的不便表示歉意。

sentences.sContent: It is with great regret that I must decline your offer.
sentences.sCn: 很遗憾，我不得不谢绝你的好意。

sentences.sContent: ...could have said something that she might regret later89...
...Those who take risks they later regret usually focus on immolate benefits and simply haven't considered what might go wrong...

phrases.pCn: 对做过的事表示遗憾、后悔

words.tran: 令人遗憾的；可惜的；可悲的；抱歉的

trans.tranOther: to feel sorry about sth you have done or about sth that you have not been able to do
sadness that you feel about something, especially because you wish it had not happened
